resources.string: SMART AIR helps children (ages 6–16) understand asthma, practice good inhaler technique, log medicines and symptoms, and safely share reports with parents and providers.
• Child – logs medicine and symptoms, learns with technique helpers.\n • Parent – manages children, views dashboards, controls sharing.\n • Provider – views reports only when a Parent grants access.

• Rescue Inhaler – quick relief for sudden symptoms.
 • Controller Medicine – daily medicine that prevents swelling.
 • Peak Flow (PEF) – a number showing how fast air is blown out.
 • Personal Best (PB) – your highest healthy PEF; used to define zones.
 • Triggers – things that cause symptoms (dust, pets, smoke, exercise).

• Medicine Logging – record rescue and controller doses.
 • Technique Helper – step-by-step inhaler guidance with animations.
 • Daily Check-ins – log coughs, triggers, and sleep issues.
 • Triage – get help when symptoms worsen.
 • Dashboard and Reports – view progress and export data.
Privacy first: only the Parent can share a child’s data with a Provider.
